title: fix: seed tier uses 90-day commit window, update UI to weekly
author: ElliotEtag

gist.headline: Calendar-proof seeds
gist.blurb: The new year used to wipe your commit history for tier upgrades. We fixed that. Your last 90 days now count, regardless of what the calendar says.
gist.summary: Updated Seed tier qualification to track commits over a rolling 90-day window instead of the calendar year.
gist.impact: Developers won't lose their Seed status in January, and the UI now accurately reflects the weekly evaluation schedule.
gist.visual_concept: Polly the Bee tending to a seedling that is growing strong despite a calendar on the wall showing January. Represents growth continuity and resilience against arbitrary dates.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the cute bee mascot watering a sprouting code-plant next to a wall calendar showing a page turn. Cozy 8-bit pixel art aesthetic. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. The bee has chunky retro sprites and a tiny scarf. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley or A Short Hike. Pixel text: 'CONTINUITY'. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.
